result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Johnny D. Junior was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay fine of $600.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  (bond from file 14CF339 to apply)
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Spend 90 days in the county jail.  Huber privileges allowed.  ELM not allowed.  To report today, 12/10/15 by 5pm.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

timeConds.notes: Credit for 2 days served.  Huber privileges allowed.  ELM not allowed.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Angela Komp.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Amended Information filed.  Counts 2 & 3 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation waived by parties.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions.  Conditions include serving 90 days in Co. Jail w/Huber commencing today by 5:00 p.m., credit for 2 days served.  Def. is not eligible for ELM.  To pay fine of $600 + costs as a condition of probation.  Balance of cash bond in 14CF339 to apply to fine & costs due; any balance to be paid during term of probation.  Driving privileges revoked for 24 months.  Ignition interlock ordered.  Alcohol assessment ordered.
from WCS - noncompliant by failing to report to WCS as directed.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Johnny D. Junior, appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: PT
Upon hearing arguments made by parties court grants State's motion to amend the information.  Court takes judicial notice of the jury trial transcript in 13CM669 and finds Carlton Cowie is qualified to testify as an expert witness.  Atty Komp requests adjournment of upcoming trial to secure their own expert and Atty Trigg is not objecting to that request.  Court grants adjournment of trial on 10/5/15 and files 14CF204 & 14CF339 will trail as a Status.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS - Defendant is Compliant

Court holds State's motion to amend the information at this time.  Motion Hearing on 9/15/15 at 1:30 PM (30 min. expected)

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:41am-  Matter heard with 14CF204 & 14CF339.  Victim rights compliance.  DE recently enrolled in an inpatient treatment program with an approximate release date of 8/21/2014.  Discussion held re: why the DE has not been reporting to WCS.  At the request of both parties, Court suspends the DE's reporting requirement to WCS until he is released from his inpatient treatment program.  DA Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial adjourned to September 24, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
